intro: Stenocarpus intermedius, commonly known as the silky oak, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and distinctive pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Proteaceae and is known for its hard, heavy timber which is highly valued for its durability. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in native habitats.
